Get nosa table for a popid

Source: R/rcax_nosa.R
rcax_nosa.Rd

Returns nosa table sorted by popid and spawningyear. The default columns to return are "recoverydomain", "esu_dps", "commonpopname", "commonname", "run", "popid", "majorpopgroup", "spawningyear", "nosaij", "nosaej"

The NOSA table_id is "4EF09E86-2AA8-4C98-A983-A272C2C2C7E3"

rcax_nosa() will download 1000 records from the NOSA table. You will probably want to make a filtered query by passing in value for a specific popid, e.g. rcax_nosa(popid=7)

rcax_nosa(
  table_id = "4EF09E86-2AA8-4C98-A983-A272C2C2C7E3",
  popid = NULL,
  extra = NULL,
  key = NULL,
  parse = TRUE,
  cols = c("recoverydomain", "esu_dps", "commonpopname", "commonname", "run", "popid",
    "majorpopgroup", "spawningyear", "nosaij", "nosaej"),
  ...
)

Arguments

table_id

table id eg 4EF09E86-2AA8-4C98-A983-A272C2C2C7E3

popid

a popid number

extra

extra query params or column values. Enter as a list, e.g. list(pageno=7)

key

A CAX API token. See rcax_key.

parse

(logical) Whether to parse to list (FALSE) or data.frame (TRUE). Default: TRUE

cols

column names to return. Use cols=NULL if you want all columns

...

Curl options passed to HttpClient

References

API docs at https://www.streamnet.org/resources/exchange-tools/rest-api-documentation/

This function is modeled off the functions in https://github.com/ropensci/rredlist

Examples

a <- rcax_nosa(popid=7)
a[, c("popid", "spawningyear", "nosaij", "nosaej")]
#>    popid spawningyear nosaij nosaej

a <- rcax_nosa()
